space.arim.universal.util.concurrent

Class DelayFunctions

  • java.lang.Object
    • space.arim.universal.util.concurrent.DelayFunctions

  • public final class DelayFunctions
extends Object
    Provides default implementations for EnhancedExecutor's scheduling methods' delay function parameters.
    Recall that Binary operators take into account execution time, while Unary operators do not.

    Fixed delay: fixedDelay()
    Fixed rate: fixedRate()
    Linear delay: linear(long)
    Exponential delay: exponential(long)
    Logarithmic delay: logarithmic(long)
    Author:
    A248

    • Method Detail

      • fixedDelay

        public static LongUnaryOperator fixedDelay()
        Schedules at a constant delay between executions.
        Returns:
        a LongUnaryOperator which yields the same delay

      • fixedRate

        public static LongBinaryOperator fixedRate()
        Schedules at a fixed rate of delay, meaning execution initiates at constant intervals.
        Attempts to ignore execution time by subtracting it from the next interval; the result is a fixed rate of scheduling provided execution time is not longer than the rate.

        For example, if the fixed rate is 4 seconds, an execution timeline might be as follows:
        |--- d ----| |E| |- d -| |--E--| |- d -|
        |- 4 secs -| | 4 secs | |-- 4 secs --|
        where E represents an execution and d is a period of delay.

        Should execution time take longer than the fixed rate of delay, the function will:
        1. Return a zero (nonexistent) delay to immediately commence the next execution. 2. Temporarily accelerate future executions in order to "correct" any waverings from the fixed rate schedule. Thus, if a single execution takes a long time, it will not ruin the rate
        Returns:
        a LongBinaryOperator which yields the same rate of delay

      • linear

        public static LongUnaryOperator linear(long slope)
        A linearly increasing delay.
        The delay is incremented each invocation by the slope.
        The function may be made decreasing by specifying a negative slope.
        Parameters:
        slope - the amount to add each invocation
        Returns:
        a linear delay function

      • exponential

        public static LongUnaryOperator exponential(long base)
        An exponentially increasing delay.
        The delay is multiplied each invocation by the base.
        The function may be made decreasing by specifying a negative base.
        Parameters:
        base - the amount by which to multiply each invocation
        Returns:
        an exponential delay function

      • logarithmic

        public static LongUnaryOperator logarithmic(long base)
        A logarithmically increasing delay, computed as follows:
        Let x be the previous delay and b be the specified base. The result is ln(b^x+1)/lnb.
        Parameters:
        base - the logarithmic base
        Returns:
        a logarithmic delay function
